item.title: Report E-2025020332
item.description:
Report E-2025020332

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 9:34 AM ET, XLU contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside of a trailer in Louisville, KY. The spill consists of approximately 5 ounces of N-Pentane, which released from 1–55-gallon metal drum due to a small puncture likely caused by other freight prior to arrival, impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will overpack the drum into 1–85-gallon poly drum along with the absorbents.

item.title: Report E-2025020257
item.description:
Report E-2025020257

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 19, 2025, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1487 was damaged and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES placed the damaged bag into one (1) 55-gallon drum and utilized hand tools to collect all released product in the same one (1) drum.
